feed.title: Ryohei Seto’s web site
feed.subtitle: I am a researcher working on soft-matter physics, complex fluid mechanics, and rheology with Prof Masao Doi at Beihang University in Beijing. I'm interested in non-equilibrium dissipative dynamics in soft-matter systems.

entry.title: Shear jamming and fragility in dense suspensions

link.title: Shear jamming and fragility in dense suspensions

entry.content:
arXiv

The phenomenon of shear-induced jamming is a factor in the complex rheological behavior of dense suspensions. Such shear-jammed states are fragile, i.e., they are not stable against applied stresses that are incompatible with the stress imposed to create them. This peculiar flow-history dependence of the stress response is due to flow-induced microstructures. To examine jammed states realized under constant shear stress, we perform dynamic simulations of non-Brownian particles with frictional contact forces and hydrodynamic lubrication forces. We find clear signatures that distinguish these fragile states from the more conventional isotropic jammed states.

entry.title: Generalization of material functions

entry.title: Extensional flow simulation paper on JFM

link.title: Extensional flow simulation paper on JFM

entry.content:
Our paper for extensional flow simulations is featured in Focus on Fluids by Prof. Helen Wilson: ‘Shear thickening’ in non-shear flows: the effect of microstructure

The cover image of Journal of Fluid Mechanics is from our work!
entry.summary: Our paper for extensional flow simulations is featured in Focus on Fluids by Prof. Helen Wilson: ‘Shear thickening’ in non-shear flows: the effect of microstructure
